Module methanol
Package com.github.mizosoft.methanol

Class MoreBodySubscribers

java.lang.Object
com.github.mizosoft.methanol.MoreBodySubscribers
public class MoreBodySubscribers extends Object
Provides additional HttpResponse.BodySubscriber implementations.

  • Method Details

    • fromAsyncSubscriber

      public static <T,​ S extends Flow.Subscriber<? super List<ByteBuffer>>> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> fromAsyncSubscriber​(S downstream, Function<? super S,​? extends CompletionStage<T>> asyncFinisher)
      Returns a BodySubscriber that forwards the response body to the given downstream. The body's completion depends on the completion of the CompletionStage returned by the given function. Unlike HttpResponse.BodySubscribers.fromSubscriber(Subscriber, Function), the given subscriber's onComplete or onError need not be called for the body to complete.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the body
      S - the type of the subscriber
      Parameters:
      downstream - the receiver of the response body
      asyncFinisher - a function that maps the subscriber to an async task upon which the body completion is dependant

    • withReadTimeout

      public static <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> withReadTimeout​(HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> base, Duration timeout)
      Returns a BodySubscriber<T> that completes the given downstream with HttpReadTimeoutException if a requested signal is not received within the given timeout. A system-wide scheduler is used to schedule timeout events.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout is non-positive

    • withReadTimeout

      public static <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> withReadTimeout​(HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> base, Duration timeout, ScheduledExecutorService scheduler)
      Returns a BodySubscriber<T> that completes the given downstream with HttpReadTimeoutException if a requested signal is not received within the given timeout. The given ScheduledExecutorService is used to schedule timeout events.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout is non-positive

    • ofByteChannel

      public static HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<ReadableByteChannel> ofByteChannel()
      Returns a completed BodySubscriber of ReadableByteChannel that reads the response body. The channel returned by the subscriber is interruptible.

      To ensure proper release of resources, the channel should be fully consumed until EOF is reached. If such consumption cannot be guaranteed, either the channel should be eventually closed or the thread which is blocked on reading the channel should be interrupted. Note however that doing so will render the underlying connection unusable for subsequent requests.

    • ofReader

      public static HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<Reader> ofReader​(Charset charset)
      Returns a completed BodySubscriber of Reader that reads the response body as a stream of characters decoded using the given charset.

      To ensure proper release of resources, the reader should be fully consumed until EOF is reached. If such consumption cannot be guaranteed, the reader should be eventually closed. Note however that doing so will render the underlying connection unusable for subsequent requests.

      Parameters:
      charset - the charset with which the response bytes are decoded

    • ofObject

      public static <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<T> ofObject​(TypeRef<T> type, @Nullable MediaType mediaType)
      Returns a BodySubscriber of T as specified by BodyAdapter.Decoder.toObject(TypeRef, MediaType) using an installed decoder.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the response body type
      Parameters:
      type - a TypeRef representing T
      mediaType - the media type
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if no Decoder that supports the given type or media type is installed

    • ofDeferredObject

      public static <T> HttpResponse.BodySubscriber<Supplier<T>> ofDeferredObject​(TypeRef<T> type, @Nullable MediaType mediaType)
      Returns a BodySubscriber of Supplier<T> as specified by BodyAdapter.Decoder.toDeferredObject(TypeRef, MediaType) using an installed decoder.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the response body type
      Parameters:
      type - a TypeRef representing T
      mediaType - the media type
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if no Decoder that supports the given type or media type is installed
